title: Java Programming: Currency Converter Challenge
description: Certification in Java fundamentals and application development, with emphasis on creating a currency converter.
description_long: This certificate validates my ability to develop robust solutions in Java, applying Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles in a practical environment. Through the 'Currency Converter Challenge', I gained experience in consuming external APIs for real-time data, exception handling for greater application resilience, and building intuitive user interfaces. This project allowed me to consolidate my knowledge in system integration and efficient data management, demonstrating my ability to transform complex requirements into clear and operational functionalities. The experience provided me with a solid foundation in the software development lifecycle, from design to implementation and testing.
learned: Design and development of Java applications using OOP.
Integration with RESTful APIs to obtain external data (exchange rates).
Advanced exception handling and user input validation.
Implementation of business logic for accurate currency conversions.
Use of data structures for efficient information management.
Clean code principles and refactoring for maintainable code.

Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration
Postman or similar tools for API testing
ExchangeRate API (or similar) for currency data

Solving complex problems and debugging Java code.
Working with external data and its processing in an application.

Application of agile methodologies in a short-duration project.

title: Programming Logic: Secret Friend Challenge (HTML, CSS, JS)
description: Practical project in programming logic and frontend development with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
description_long: This 10-hour challenge was a practical immersion in applying programming logic to solve a real problem: the 'secret friend' draw. I used HTML to structure the interface, CSS for an attractive and responsive design, and JavaScript to implement the core logic of the draw, including DOM manipulation and event management. This project allowed me to consolidate my frontend development skills, demonstrating my ability to transform ideas into interactive and functional web applications. It was an excellent opportunity to reinforce my knowledge in the fundamental triad of web development.
learned: Structuring web content with semantic HTML.
Design and styling of user interfaces with CSS (including responsiveness).
Implementation of programming logic with JavaScript.
DOM manipulation to create dynamic interactions.
Event and function management in JavaScript.
Development of algorithms for random draws and unique assignments.
tools_used: Visual Studio Code (or similar code editor)
Git and GitHub (for project version control)
experience_gained: Development of an interactive web application from scratch.
Practical application of programming logic concepts.
Creation of attractive and functional user interfaces.
Solving assignment and randomness problems.
Improvement of frontend code debugging skills.
benefits: Mastery of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals for web development.
Ability to build interactive and dynamic web applications.
Understanding of programming logic applied to real problems.
Preparation for junior frontend developer roles.

title: Python Essentials 1: Programming Fundamentals
issuer: Cisco Networking Academy & OpenEDG Python Institute
description: Fundamental Python certification covering from basic concepts to PCEP certification preparation.
description_long: This intensive 30-hour course provided me with a solid foundation in Python programming, essential for any aspiring developer. Through 30 hands-on labs, I mastered algorithmic thinking, procedural programming, and coding best practices. The training thoroughly prepared me for the PCEP (Certified Entry-Level Python Programmer) certification, validating my ability to design, develop, and debug Python scripts. This experience was crucial for developing analytical thinking and efficiently solving problems, laying the groundwork for more complex projects in the future.
learned: Introduction to Python and computer programming.
Data types, variables, operators, and basic I/O operations in Python.
Control flow: Boolean values, conditional execution, and loops.
Data structures: lists, tuples, and dictionaries, and their processing.
Functions, exception handling, and data processing.
Principles of design, development, and debugging of Python scripts.
tools_used: Git concepts for version control (although not directly used in the course, it is an essential complementary tool)
experience_gained: Development of Python scripts for basic task automation.
Solving algorithmic problems using Python.
Effective debugging of Python code.
Application of good programming practices from the start.
Preparation for entry-level Python certification exams.
benefits: Mastery of Python fundamentals to start a development career.
Ability to write clean, efficient, and debuggable Python code.
Understanding of algorithmic thinking and programming logic.
Solid foundation for learning more advanced Python frameworks and libraries.
Recognized certification that validates Python programming skills.

title: Introduction to Cybersecurity
description: Essential cybersecurity fundamentals to protect data and systems in a digital world.
description_long: This 6-hour course, complemented by 7 hands-on labs, provided me with a fundamental understanding of cybersecurity principles and challenges. I explored the most common cyber threats, network vulnerabilities, and strategies to protect data privacy and confidentiality. The training equipped me with cyber best practices, both at personal and organizational levels, and introduced me to various career paths in the cybersecurity field. This experience was crucial for developing a proactive security mindset and understanding the importance of information protection in today's digital environment.
learned: Fundamental cybersecurity concepts and their importance.
Identification and analysis of cyberattacks, concepts, and techniques.
Strategies to protect personal data and online privacy.
Security measures to protect an organization's information and assets.
Exploration of career opportunities in the cybersecurity field.
Detection of threats and network vulnerabilities.
tools_used: Network simulation tools (e.g., Packet Tracer, although not directly mentioned, it is common in Cisco courses)
Operating system concepts (Windows, Linux) to understand vulnerabilities
Web browsers and basic security tools (e.g., VPN, antivirus)

Application of security measures to protect systems and data.
Identification of security risks in everyday and business environments.
Development of critical awareness about digital security.
Understanding the importance of privacy and confidentiality.
benefits: Solid knowledge of cybersecurity fundamentals.

title: Git and GitHub: Professional Version Control
description: Mastery of Git and GitHub for efficient repository management, team collaboration, and version control.
description_long: This 6-hour course provided me with a deep and practical understanding of Git and GitHub, essential tools for modern software development. I learned to manage repositories, make effective commits, work collaboratively with teams, and handle branching and merging efficiently. The training covered from initial GitHub account setup to advanced techniques for maintaining a clean and organized version history. This skill is fundamental for any development project, ensuring code integrity and facilitating contribution in professional environments.

Making atomic and meaningful commits for a clear version history.
Collaborative workflows: clone, pull, push, fork, and pull requests.
Creation and management of branches for new feature development and bug fixes.
Efficient resolution of merge conflicts.
Use of VS Code and other tools for Git integration.
Advanced Git concepts to optimize version control.
experience_gained: Management of software projects with distributed version control.
Effective collaboration in development teams using GitHub.
Maintenance of a clean and auditable code history.
Implementation of best practices in development workflow.
Resolution of common version control issues.
benefits: Essential skill for any software developer role.
Ability to work efficiently in development teams.
Ensure source code integrity and traceability.
Improved productivity and reduced development errors.
Preparation to contribute to open-source projects.
